intro: Appendicula tenuifolia var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf appendicula, is a species of flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are typically narrow and elongated. The plant produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and bog gardens.
